results.title: My Brilliant Career paperback
results.brief_description: My Brilliant Career, adapted from Stella Miles Franklin’s 1901 novel of the same name, was Gillian Armstrong’s first feature film and a global success, gaining Academy Award and Palme d’Or nominations.

constellations_primary.name: Pen names, poems and puppets
constellations_primary.description: Discover how big-screen adaptations of novels connect to web-based poetry and Jim Henson's Fraggle Rock.

results.description: Paperback book ‘My Brilliant Career’, with soft cover and the title written on front in red ‘My Brilliant Career’, on a black background and in white text authors name ‘Miles Franklin’.

results.title: Mad Max Beyond Thunderdome publicity image
results.credit_line: Courtesy Kennedy Miller Mitchell Films Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: George Miller’s Mad Max revolutionised movies when it tore through cinemas in 1979. Bursting with stunning practical effects, explosive set pieces and iconic costumes, the original Mad Max trilogy (1979-85) cemented its place in pop culture before roaring back to life 30 years later.
results.credit_line_for_label: Courtesy Kennedy Miller Mitchell Films Pty Ltd

results.title: Live broadcast at the launch of EVTV
results.brief_description:
EVTV live broadcast to Ernabella (Pukatja) community, 1985

Pantjiti McKenzie OAM presents a live broadcast during the launch of “Ernabella Video Television” (EVTV) to Pukatja community (Ernabella) in the Pitjantjatjara Lands of South Australia.
